intro: Ecbolium asclepiadeum, commonly known as the milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. Its milky sap contains toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to humans and animals. Ecbolium asclepiadeum is often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
